Package com.redis.foundation.app

Class AppCtx

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.app.AppCtx
public class AppCtx extends Object
The Application Context provides a number of services to a parent application while simplifying the interfaces needed to use them. The list of services provided include:
  • Command line processing
  • Configuration property management
  • Robust logging facility
  • Task (a.k.a. thread) management

Much of this framework was designed around the application context to ensure consistency and code reuse.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole
See Also:
  • Logback Project
  • Apache Commons CLI
  • Apache Commons Configuration
  • Dealing with InterruptedException

    • AppCtx

      public AppCtx()
      Default constructor.

    • AppCtx

      public AppCtx(Map<String,Object> aProperties)
      Constructor suitable for use within JUnit or main line classes where a minimal application context is needed.
      Parameters:
      aProperties - Map of name/value pairs.

    • AppCtx

      public AppCtx(String aInsPathName, String aCfgPathName, String aLogPathName, String aDSPathName)
      Constructor suitable for use within Servlet Container where the default paths for the application are difficult to derive automatically.
      Parameters:
      aInsPathName - Installation path name.
      aCfgPathName - Configuration path name.
      aLogPathName - Log file output path name.
      aDSPathName - Data source path name.

    • AppCtx

      public AppCtx(String aInsPathName, String aCfgPathName, String aLogPathName, String aDSPathName, String anRDBMSPathName, String aDataPathName)
      Constructor suitable for use within Servlet Container where the default paths for the application are difficult to derive automatically.
      Parameters:
      aInsPathName - Installation path name.
      aCfgPathName - Configuration path name.
      aLogPathName - Log file output path name.
      aDSPathName - Data source path name.
      anRDBMSPathName - RDBMS path name.
      aDataPathName - Data path name.

  • Method Details

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Returns true if the task manager is active and not in the process of shutting down and false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • setIsAliveFlag

      public void setIsAliveFlag(boolean aFlag)
      Assigns the boolean flag to the internally managed "is alive" boolean value. This method should only be called by the shutdown handler method.
      Parameters:
      aFlag - Boolean flag.

    • isAbortHandlerEnabled

      public boolean isAbortHandlerEnabled()
      Returns true if the task manager is configured to use an internal abort (a.k.a. JVM addShutdownHook method) handler.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • setAbortHandlerEnabledFlag

      public void setAbortHandlerEnabledFlag(boolean anIsEnabled)
      Enables/disables the use of an internal abort (a.k.a. JVM addShutdownHook method) handler.
      Parameters:
      anIsEnabled - Boolean flag.

    • addTask

      public void addTask(Task aTask)
      Adds an application manager task to the internal queue of managed task threads.
      Parameters:
      aTask - Application manager task.

    • getTaskByRunName

      public Task getTaskByRunName(String aName)
      Returns a Task matching the parameter run name.
      Parameters:
      aName - Run name of the task.
      Returns:
      A Task or null if not found.

    • getTaskByTestName

      public Task getTaskByTestName(String aName)
      Returns a Task matching the parameter test name.
      Parameters:
      aName - Test name of the task.
      Returns:
      A Task or null if not found.

    • loadPropertyFiles

      public void loadPropertyFiles() throws FCException
      Loads the default property files ("application.properties" and "logback.xml") from the file system and assigns default application properties.

      Note: This method will establish a default 5 minute reloading policy for the "application.properties" file. Therefore, any changes to this property file while the application is running will be recognized within a 5 minute period.

      Throws:
      FCException - Typically thrown for I/O related issues.

    • init

      public void init(String[] aCmdLineArgs) throws FCException
      Initializes the application manager command line processing subsystem using the arguments provided from the parent application.
      Parameters:
      aCmdLineArgs - An array of command line arguments (typically handed down from the application main method).
      Throws:
      FCException - Thrown when the command line arguments are invalid.

    • init

      public void init(org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration aConfiguration) throws FCException
      Initializes the application manager property management subsystem using the composite configuration parameter instance.
      Parameters:
      aConfiguration - Apache Commons configuration instance.
      Throws:
      FCException - Thrown when the command line arguments are invalid.
      See Also:
      • Apache Commons Configuration

    • execute

      public void execute() throws FCException
      Executes one or more application tasks based on the the run/test command line argument.

      Note:If the word "all" is specified for the run/test argument parameter, then all tasks defined for this application manager will be executed in parallel. Otherwise, only the task that matches the run/test name will be executed.

      Throws:
      FCException - Could be thrown by the executing task.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shutdowns all active tasks associated with this application manager.

    • getCommandLine

      public org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine getCommandLine()
      Returns the command line instance. You would typically use this method if your application requires specialized logic for command line processing.
      Returns:
      Apache Commons Command Line instance.
      See Also:
      • Apache Commons CLI

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Optional data item instance

    • setMultiValueParsingFlag

      public void setMultiValueParsingFlag(boolean aFlag)
      Identifies whether the property parsing logic should recognize multi-values (comma delimiter) when parsing values. The default is true.
      Parameters:
      aFlag - If false multi-value parsing is disabled.

    • getConfiguration

      public org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration getConfiguration()
      Returns the composite configuration instance. You would typically use this method if your application requires specialized logic for property management.
      Returns:
      Apache Commons Configuration Composite instance.
      See Also:
      • Apache Commons Configuration

      Returns:

    • getLogger

      public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(Class<?> aClass)
      Returns a logger instance matching the class parameter. The name associated with the class instance is used for the logger identity.
      Parameters:
      aClass - Class instance to base identity on.
      Returns:
      An output logger instance.
      See Also:
      • Logback Project

    • getLogger

      public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(Object aClass, String aMethod)
      Returns a logger instance matching the class parameter. The name associated with the class instance and the method name are used for the logger identity.
      Parameters:
      aClass - Class instance to base identity on.
      aMethod - Method name to base identity on.
      Returns:
      An output logger instance.
      See Also:
      • Logback Project

      Parameters:
      aLogger - An output logger instance.
      See Also:

    • dataGridFromProperties

      public DataGrid dataGridFromProperties(String aPrefix)
      Extracts all of the configuration properties into a two column data grid.
      Parameters:
      aPrefix - Filters the entries to only those that match the prefix string
      Returns:
      DataGrid instance

    • dataGridFromProperties

      public DataGrid dataGridFromProperties()
      Extracts all of the configuration properties into a two column data grid.
      Returns:
      DataGrid instance

    • addProperty

      public void addProperty(String aName, Object anObject)
      Add an application defined property to the application manager.

      Notes:

      • The goal of the AppCtx is to strike a balance between providing enough properties to adequately model application related data without overloading it.
      • This method offers a mechanism to capture additional (application specific) properties that may be needed.
      • Properties added with this method are transient and will not be persisted when saved.
      Parameters:
      aName - Property name (duplicates are not supported).
      anObject - Instance of an object.

    • removeProperty

      public void removeProperty(String aName)
      Removes the property from the internally managed map.
      Parameters:
      aName - Property name.

    • getProperty

      public Object getProperty(String aName)
      Returns the object associated with the property name or null if the name could not be matched.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the property.
      Returns:
      Instance of an object.

    • clearProperties

      public void clearProperties()
      Removes all application defined properties assigned to this application manager.
